intro: Astragalus cremnophylax, commonly known as the Greek milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Greece and Turkey. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are compound, with slender leaflets that help reduce water loss. Astragalus cremnophylax is also valued for its role in traditional medicine and ecological restoration projects.
